title: Science and Applications of Biomimicry
description: Nature is full of wonders, beauty and wisdom. For so long we have been trying to learn ‘about’ nature. In fact there are so much we can learn ‘from’ it as if nature is our mentor. Biomimicry is about learning from Nature and emulate their designs to innovate sustainable solutions. For example, the hooks found on burs has inspired the invention of Velcro®, a fabric hook and loop fastener.Biomimicry provides an excellent platform to engage students in collaborative problem-based and integrated learning to solve real-world problems. Students will learn to work together and develop their creative problem-solving skills through identifying meaningful questions, searching relevant and credible information, developing sustainable solutions, and evaluating and sharing their solutions. It provides a new perspective for students to view questions differently and appreciate and value the natural world that we all share and live in.
outcome: 1. Define biomimicry, and explain how they lead to sustainable design solutions;  2. Identify and define a real world challenge; 3. Search and identify relevant nature’s strategies from credible sources; 4. Develop a sustainable design solution with a biomimetic approach; 5. Evaluate and share a conceptual design solution professionally to corresponding audiences; 6. Collaborate effectively with others -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. 定義仿生學，及解釋仿生學如何有助設計一個可持續的解決方案； 2. 釐清及界定一個現實世界的問題； 3. 從可靠的資料來源，找出與問題相關的大自然方案； 4. 使用仿生學方法，從概念上研發可持續的解決方案； 5. 評估解決方案及專業地向受眾分享； 6. 與團隊有效地合作
syllabus: Topics • Introduction to course and biomimicry • Design thinking and biomimicry • Identifying the design challenge  • Exploring nature’s solutions • Exploring nature’s patterns • Creating nature inspired ideas • Evaluating design projects  • Sharing design solutions -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 題目 • 仿生學簡介及總覽 • 設計思考與仿生學 • 尋找及界定問題 • 探索自然界的方案 • 探索自然界的模式 • 從大自然提取解決方案的靈感 • 評估解決方案 • 分享設計方案

title: Career Path Planning
description: This course is designed to guide students in articulating and exploring their career pathways by helping them identify the most suitable career options within science disciplines across various industries. It aims to assist students in planning their career paths during their undergraduate studies.Participants will learn how to search for a range of science jobs related to their discipline and prepare a list of categorized potential careers. They will develop a comprehensive career plan that encompasses both academic and career preparation. Students are expected to reflect on and explore their own interests, strengths, and weaknesses, and will learn to self-assess their academic and non-academic achievements. Additionally, they will be taught how to create portfolios, personal statements, and CVs that effectively highlight their strengths specifically in science fields. The course will also provide opportunities for students to practice interviews, helping them build confidence in these critical contexts.
outcome: 1. Make Informed Career Choices: Students will be able to analyze and select suitable career paths within their discipline by considering industry trends, personal interests, and skill sets.2. Craft Effective Personal Statements and CVs: Students will identify and articulate the essential elements of personal statements and CVs, tailoring these documents to effectively showcase their strengths and experiences relevant to specific job applications.3. Demonstrate Interview Skills: Students will participate confidently in job interviews, utilizing effective communication techniques and strategies to articulate their qualifications and fit the role.4. Conduct Self-Assessment and Reflection: Students will engage in self-assessment to evaluate their academic and non-academic achievements, enabling them to better understand their strengths, weaknesses, and areas for growth as they navigate their career paths.
syllabus: 1: Introduction to Career PathwaysOverview of career planning and its importance.Understanding personal interests, strengths, and weaknesses.2: Industry InsightsWhat employers seek in candidates across different science disciplines.Engaging with industry panels and networking opportunities.3: Career Research and ExplorationTechniques for researching job fields.Identifying and categorizing potential career options.4: Self-AssessmentTools for self-assessing academic and non-academic achievements.Reflective practices to understand personal motivations and goals.5: Career PreparationCrafting effective portfolios and personal statements.Resume writing: Highlighting strengths and relevant experiences.6: Interview SkillsStrategies for interview preparation and practice.7. Mock InterviewBuilding confidence through mock interviews assessment and feedback sessions.

title: Healthy Ageing
description: As ageing becomes an increasingly pressing global challenge, it is essential for future scientists to address the complexities of this phenomenon. This course offers science students a unique opportunity to explore the intricate interplay of biological, genetic, and environmental factors that shape healthy ageing.By focusing on key areas such as regenerative biology, genetics, nutrition, and environmental influences, students will gain a thorough understanding of the mechanisms that underlie the ageing process and explore innovative interventions aimed at promoting longevity and cognitive health. Through a dynamic blend of lectures, discussions, and project work, students will study the latest findings in regenerative medicine, genetic predispositions related to ageing and assess how environmental conditions impact health outcomes for older adults. This course prepares students to contribute meaningfully to solutions for the challenges posed by an ageing population.
outcome: 1. Explain the biological processes of ageing, including regenerative mechanisms and their implications for health.2. Assess the role of genetics in longevity and age-related diseases.3. Evaluate how nutrition and environmental factors influence health outcomes in older adults and propose evidence-based strategies for intervention.4. Design a comprehensive health promotion plan that incorporates regenerative biology principles and environmental considerations to enhance quality of life in older adults.
syllabus: 1. Introduction to Healthy Ageing- Overview of ageing; definitions and significance of healthy ageing.2. Regenerative Biology and Ageing- Exploration of stem cells, their roles in tissue repair and how regenerative capacity declines with age.3. Genetics of Ageing- Discussion on genetic predispositions affecting longevity and key genes associated with age-related diseases.4. Environmental Factors in Healthy Ageing- Examination of how pollutions and access to resources impact health outcomes for older adults.5. Brain Health and Cognitive Decline- Overview of age-related neurological disorders, impact on mental health and strategies for cognitive enhancement.6. Physiological Changes in Ageing- Overview of biological changes and effects on health and function across systems.7. Nutrition for Healthy Ageing- Nutritional requirements tailored for older adults and dietary patterns promoting longevity.8. Physical Activity Guidelines for Older Adults- Importance and types of physical activities beneficial for maintaining health.9. Chronic Diseases and Regenerative Approaches- Common chronic conditions in older adults and potential regenerative therapies.10. Future Directions in Healthy Ageing Research- Emerging technologies and interventions in regenerative medicine, and implications for public health policies.
recommended_readings: David, L. S. (2017). Regenerative Medicine and the Biology of AgingRobert, A. B. (2020). Biology of Longevity and Aging: Pathways and Prospects, 4th Edition

title: Workshop on Data Science
description: This course provides an opportunity for students to apply their knowledge to solve real-world problem. Students will be required to complete an individual project, give a final project presentation and submit a written report, on which their assessment will be based. Advisory: For students from Data Sciences Concentration (B.Sc. in Natural Sciences) only.
outcome: Upon completion of the course, students should be able to (1) conduct research on practical problems in statistics; (2) apply statistical methods learnt in different courses; (3) learn presentation skills. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 完成本科後，學生應能夠（1）對實際統計問題進行研究; （2）應用不同課程的統計方法; （3）學習演講技巧。

title: Internship
description: This course provides opportunities for students to put knowledge and skills they learned from their corresponding concentration area into practice via engaging in a real-life experience in the government, private companies or non-governmental organizations. Internship can be held either locally or overseas, but must be approved by the Programme. Students are worked under the joint supervision of an academic supervisor and his/her agency supervisor and submit a report that reflects on the experience in the internship by the end of the internship period.
outcome: 1. Apply knowledge and skills learned in the classroom in a work setting 2. Gain practical experience about real-world problems in a field relevant to their concentration area of studies 3. Demonstrate professionalism by actively participating in teamwork, communicating professionally and acting ethically 4. Develop and refine oral and written communication skills -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. 應用在課堂中獲得的知識及技能  2. 累積課堂以外與其專修範圍相關的工作實踐經驗 3. 通過「團隊活動」、「專業語言溝通」和「道德行事」來推動專業成長 4. 提升其書寫及語言溝通的能力
syllabus: Students should search for their own internship position and submit relevant documents to the NSCI Programme for approval. Each student is required to work within specified areas that are related to his/her current concentration area of studies for a minimum of 4 weeks (160 hours). The progress of each student will be monitored by supervisors from both the Programme and the company employing the student intern. At the end of the internship, students should give an oral presentation and submit a written report. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 學生須自行尋找本地或海外與其專修範圍相關的實習機會，並提交相關資料以取得課程認可。實習生須到認可之公司或機構工作，為期最少四星期 (160小時)。學生進度由實習機構主管及學系導師共同監察。實習完結後，學生須作口頭報告並提交書面報告。
